intro: Parosela subvillosa, commonly known as the hairy parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are typically finely divided and hairy. Parosela subvillosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
